thread.title: Reality TV star and former footballer Mark Wright to buy 20 per cent stake in non-league Billericay Town
thread.title_full: Reality TV star and former footballer Mark Wright to buy 20 per cent stake in non-league Billericay Town

author: Alex Smith
title: Reality TV star and former footballer Mark Wright to buy 20 per cent stake in non-league Billericay Town
text:
Wright is shown around New Lodge by owner Glenn Tamplin (Photo: WENN.com)   Thank you for subscribing!   
" The Only Way is Essex " star Mark Wright is set to buy a stake in non-league side Billericay Town . 
The reality TV face is expected to plunge a 20 per cent stake into the team who are in the seventh tier of the football pyramid. 
Wright went to visit the club last week to tour his investment and drew its biggest attendance of the season. 
Wright is a familiar face in the sport after spending his childhood playing for West Ham, Arsenal and Tottenham's academies. Wright celebrates scoring during Soccer Aid (Photo: Action Images via Reuters / Ed Sykes) Wright played for West Ham, Arsenal and Tottenham in his youth (Photo: Jake Darling) He also made a solid career as a non-league left back (Photo: Jake Darling) 
In adult football, Wright spent time at Football League Southend before becoming a regular fixture outside the top four division. 
He played for Lewes, Grays Athletic, Crawley, Rushden and Diamonds, St Albans City, Bishop's Stortford, Fisher Athletic, Thurrock and Heybridge Swifts as a left back before he found fame. 
A source told the Sun said: “Mark has always loved football and is known for being a talented player, but obviously he never quite made it to the big time. He sees this as a great way to get involved with the sport and hopes to make a real impact. 
“They’re very ambitious about where the club could end up. Wright found the limelight through reality soap TOWIE (Photo: Rex Features) Billericay Town play at New Lodge (Photo: Rex Features) Wright is expected to buy a 20 per cent stake in the club (Photo: Jake Darling) 
“Glenn and Mark have been friends for some time. Glenn believes ­having a famous face involved could give the club a publicity boost so he proposed the deal. He is a steel magnate worth about £50million so he can ­certainly afford it.” 
Wright will be teaming up with current owner and manager Glenn Tamplin - who is an millionaire mate. 
Tamplin is pumping in between £7,500 and £10,000 a week into the Essex club has already signed former England international Paul Konchesky. 
He has plans to upgrade their 3,500 capacity New Lodge ground into a 6,000 seater stadium in a bid to lift Ricay from the Isthmian League Premier. poll loading Will Billericay Town make it to the Football League with Mark Wright's involvement? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
